abstract: Obama administration dispatches high-level officials from several agencies to allay concerns about swine flu and to demonstrate its preparedness to confront outbreak; Pres Obama says there is no cause for alarm, even as Janet Napolitano, homeland security secretary, and Dr Richard E Besser, acting director of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, say they expect outbreak to spread and are proceeding as if preparatory to full pandemic level; administration responds to first domestic emergency by building on concrete preparations made during Bush administration that won praise by health experts; aides to Obama are also mindful that political management of crisis, and of public expectations, can be as important as immediate response; swine flu outbreak is linked to 149 deaths in Mexico; number of confirmed cases in US grows to 45; photo; map (L)
